questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols is considered a hybrid routing protocol?

discussion.content: A hybrid routing protocol has some characteristics of a link state routing protocol, and some characteristics of a distance vector routing protocol. An example of a hybrid routing protocol would be something like EIGRP. This is Cisco's Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol.
This answer is wrong, it should be bgp

OK. D is correct, but i would be doing a menial job as a network security admin if no other measures were taken to protect the network (DiD - Defence in Depth).

Key words: 

'DHCP Snoping' 

'DHCP starvation attack' - which simple resource starvation attack, just like a synchronization (SYN) flood attack and also includes mac spoofing, but I digress.

As such, answer A & B should also be a no-brainer as it to definitely be taken into account when setting up a corporate network. 

At best this Q&A sees the networking world as a two-dimensional entity (or harking back to the simpler and more innocent eras of the 1980's and '90s).

For those who want to know more:

DHCP Snoping
https://packetpushers.net/five-things-to-know-about-dhcp-snooping/

DHCP starvation attack
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0045790612001140

choices.C: The administrator is blocking the wireless router's MAC address using MAC filtering
choices.A: The administrator has enabled DHCP snooping on the network
choices.D: The Administrator has implemented a feature that only allows white-listed MAC addresses
choices.B: The administrator is blocking DHCP requests that originate from access points

questions.question_text:
Ann, an employee, has properly connected her personal wireless router to a network jack in her office. The router is unable to get a DHCP address though her corporate laptop can get a DHCP address when connected to the same jack. Ann checks the router configuration to ensure it is configured to obtain a DCHP address.
Which of the following is the MOST likely reason why the router is not receiving a DHCP address?

discussion.content:
Q: DSCP and CoS map to which of the following OSI layers? (Select TWO) 

> answers are correct B and C), but for those willing to learn (which is the purpose of this web site, I guess), an explanation as to Protocol utilises the corresponding OSI layer would be very informative.

DSCP (Differentiated Services Code Point) is layer 3; 

CoS (Class of Service) is layer 2 (but has to have Trunking enabled as it uses the 802.1Q protocol > no Trunking, no CoS).

https://networkengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/53/are-cos-and-qos-ever-interchangeable

questions.question_text: As part of unified communications services, QoS must be implemented. DSCP and CoS map to which of the following OSI layers? (Select TWO)

questions.question_text:
A network administrator noticed that when one computer goes down, all the other computers in the office will not work.
Which of the following topologies is in use?

A technician needs to use SNMP to manage several legacy devices. The technician wants to ask the vendor for specification that will provide SNMP monitoring of the devices.
Which of the following will allow SNMP monitoring of the devices?

discussion.content: MIBS? I always thought it was MIB?
